intro: Leucadendron flexuosum, commonly known as the silver leaf candle bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, cone-shaped inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that give it its common name and contribute to its drought tolerance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
